description.hltext_display: Лукин предлагает "вбивать в голову" детям идею о единстве наций в РФ
description.content: МОСКВА, 22 дек — РИА Новости. Уполномоченный по правам человека в РФ Владимир Лукин отмечает свойственную сейчас российскому обществу сильную нетерпимость и призывает прививать детям с раннего возраста уважение ко всем окружающим и воспитывать у них чувство единства нации.

description.hltext_display: Koli held guilty of rape, murder in fourth Nithari case
description.content:
GHAZIABAD: A special CBI court here today held Surinder Koli guilty of rape and murder of 12-year-old Deepali, whose body parts were found in a drain in Nithari in 2006.
Special CBI Judge A K Singh pronounced the verdict against Koli (38) while the quantum of sentence will be given tomorrow.
Deepali's case is the fourth out of a total of 16 cases filed by the CBI in connection with the rape and murder of children and a young woman whose skeletal remains were found in Nithari in 2006.
While Moninder Singh Pander and his domestic help Surinder Koli were held accused in the case initially, the CBI named Koli as the prime accused in the chargesheet, stating there was lack of evidence against Pander.
Koli was awarded death sentence by the special court in May this year for the rape and murder of teenager Rachna.
He has also been held guilty of rape and murder of 14-year-old Rimpa Haldar and 8-year-old Aarti by the special court.
The mother of Deepali, who was missing since June 2006 and whose name was mentioned in the complaint lodged in December that year about the children missing from the area, had identified her daughter through her footwear and the DNA test conducted on her skeletal remains.
A total of 19 cases were filed in connection with the rape and murder of children and a young woman in Nithari in 2006 and the CBI filed chargesheets in 16 cases. Three cases were closed without trial due to lack of evidence.

description.hltext_display: Gmail之父称Google对抗Facebook难于登月
description.content:
Gmail之父保罗·布切赫特(Paul Buchheit)表示，Google成功挑战Facebook比登月更难。业内人士指出，如果Google都不能对Facebook构成竞争威胁，其他竞争对手就更不能对Facebook构成威胁了。尽管2010年爆发一系列隐私丑闻，Facebook用户仍然增长至逾5亿。
Gmail之父保罗·布切赫特
从Google离职后，布切赫特创办的社交聚合网站FriendFeed被Facebook以5000万美元收购。布切赫特11月份从Facebook离职。
布切赫特曾表示，Google内部“组织混乱”，各团队的工作重叠或相互冲突。布切赫特还两次发表文章称，Google的Chrome OS操作系统将以失败收场。
布切赫特在接受采访时表示，他对Google的前景持乐观态度，Google将在自动驾驶汽车和登月计划方面取得更大的成功。Twitter和Foursquare都是由Google前员工创建的，当时，他们在Google工作时的表现很一般。
布切赫特说，Google在社交领域成功的一个机会是开发不同于Facebook的服务，但它缺乏合适的人才。他表示，丹尼斯·克劳利 (Dennis Crowley)2005年将其“签到”服务Dodgeball出售给Google，由于得不到管理层的支持，2年后离职。克劳利后来创建了 Foursquare。目前，Foursquare身价超过9000万美元，控制了一个Google认为非常重要的市场。

description.hltext_display: Le Japon devait voir sa croissance réduire de moitié en 2011-12
description.content:
Tokyo table sur une croissance réduite de moitié en 2011-2012
TOKYO (Reuters) - La croissance économique du Japon ralentira durant l'exercice 2011-2012 qui débute le 1er avril prochain et ne représentera plus que la moitié de celle de l'exercice en cours en raison d'un fléchissement des exportations et de la consommation intérieure, selon les prévisions diffusées mercredi par le gouvernement.
Toutefois, les prix de détail sortiront de leur spirale baissière, prévoit aussi le gouvernement japonais.
Tokyo anticipe une croissance du PIB de 1,5% réel en 2011-2012 contre 3,1% en 2010-2011.
L'inflation mesurée par les prix de détail serait nulle sur le prochain exercice, et non plus négative comme elle l'aura été sur les trois exercices précédents, et le gouvernement anticipe une inflation à nouveau positive d'ici la fin de l'exercice 2011-2012, le 31 mars 2012.
"Mais il faudra peut-être attendre encore longtemps avant que le gouvernement n'annonce que le pays est sorti définitivement de la déflation car il faut prendre en compte plusieurs indicateurs économiques", a déclaré un haut fonctionnaire ministériel.
Le gouvernement ne donne de prévision que pour les prix de détail dans leur ensemble, alors que la Banque du Japon préfère suivre ces prix hors produits alimentaires frais pour se faire une meilleure idée de l'évolution de l'inflation.
Par ailleurs, le gouvernement a révisé en baisse, dans son rapport de décembre, son opinion sur les exportations et le sentiment des entreprises en raison du ralentissement de la reprise en Asie et d'un yen qui reste fort.
Toutefois son diagnostic d'ensemble de la situation économique n'a pas varié. Il estime que l'économie reste au point mort et que sa situation est délicate, avec en particulier un taux de chômage élevé.
C'est dans son rapport d'octobre que le gouvernement avait pour la première fois depuis février 2009 revu en baisse son diagnostic d'ensemble de la situation économique.
Beaucoup d'économistes anticipent une contraction du PIB au quatrième trimestre 2010, l'expiration de mesures publiques de relance se faisant sentir sur le secteur industriel. Ils prévoient toutefois une reprise de la croissance l'an prochain, dans le sillage des exportations et de la demande intérieure.
Tokyo réaffirme enfin que l'une de ses grandes priorités est la lutte contre la déflation, avec le concours de la Banque du Japon.
Rie Ishiguro et Kaori Kaneko, Wilfrid Exbrayat pour le service français, édité par Dominique Rodriguez
FERMER X
Crédit : REUTERS
Tokyo table sur une croissance réduite de moitié en 2011-2012
Dans un quartier d'affaires de Tokyo. Selon les prévisions du gouvernement japonais, la croissance économique nipponne ralentira durant l'exercice 2011-2012 qui débute le 1er avril prochain et ne représentera plus que la moitié de celle de l'exercice en cours en raison d'un fléchissement des exportations et de la consommation intérieure. Mais les prix de détail sortiront de leur spirale baissière et l'inflation mesurée par les prix de détail serait nulle et non plus négative sur le prochain exercice. /Photo prise le 3 septembre 2010/REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon

description.hltext_display: La San Silvestre de Pamplona exigirá dorsal para entrar en meta
description.content:
Beste Iruña estima que serán más de 5.000 las personas que disputarán la última carrera del año
votos comentarios
compartir (¿qué es esto?)
Imagen obtenida en la prueba celebrada el año pasado en Pamplona. (Mikel Saiz)
Vista:
Más texto
Más visual
Galería Noticia
pamplona. La tradicional carrera de San Silvestre de Pamplona que el club Beste Iruña organiza en su 28ª edición contará como principal novedad para este año la obligación de los corredores de llevar un dorsal acreditativo para poder acceder a la meta instalada en el paseo Sarasate. Los organizadores, según explicaron ayer por la mañana durante la presentación del evento deportivo y social que supone la San Silvestre pamplonesa, tratan con esta medida de garantizar el normal desarrollo de la prueba y adecuarse a lo dispuesto en los seguros vigentes para los participantes.
Aunque no se prohibirá a nadie tomar parte en la carrera, sólo aquellos que lleguen al final y lo hagan con la inscripción debidamente cumplimentada recibirán el tradicional trofeo que todos los participantes se llevan al acabar. "No es que valga mucho, pero a todo el mundo le gusta llevarse un recuerdo. Queremos tenerlo regulado, por eso hemos querido enfatizar en que todos los atletas lleven su dorsal oficial correspondiente", comentó Jesús Albisu, organizador.
Caja Laboral, como tradicional patrocinador de la San Silvestre, acogió en una de sus oficinas de Pamplona la presentación de la carrera, que por el número de participantes sólo es superada por las que se celebran cada 31 de diciembre en Vallecas y Barcelona.
Aunque la participación dependa en gran medida de la climatología que haga ese día, los organizadores estiman que será superior a la del año pasado, cuando tomaron parte 3.800 atletas con la inscripción oficializada y más de 1.000 sin ella.
El recorrido no sufre variaciones con respecto a otras ediciones. Para la categoría absoluta, tanto en mujeres como en hombres, la carrera de 5.500 metros comenzará en la calle Navas de Tolosa y transcurrirá por Hermanos Imaz, Padre Moret, Yanguas y Miranda, plaza de la Paz, paseo Sarasate, Navas de Tolosa, avenida del Ejército, vuelta del Castillo, y regreso por Yanguas y Miranda, plaza de la Paz y paseo Sarasate, con el final a la altura de la sucursal de la Caja Laboral.
Hay otras cuatro categorías, con distintas distancias en función de la edad. Los benjamines (chicos y chicas) tendrán una carrera de 550 metros (una vuelta completa al paseo Sarasate); los alevines darán dos vueltas (1.100 metros), los infantiles darán tres (1.650), en el caso de los chicos, y dos en el de las chicas. En cadetes serán tres vueltas para las categorías femenina y especial y cuatro para la masculina (2.200 metros).
A la presentación asistió Javier Esparza, director del Instituto Navarro de Deporte; Olivia Elizari, del Ayuntamiento de Pamplona; Jesús Albisu, presidente del Beste Iruña y Javier Cortajarena, de Caja Laboral.

description.hltext_display: WikiLeaks: U.K. trained 'death squad'
description.content:
If the United States seeks to put on trial WikiLeaks and its founder, Julian Assange, what are the implications for freedom of speech, for protection of government secrets and for news organizations on the Internet?
Msnbc.com has convened a panel of legal specialists to explore questions raised by a prosecution.
As one of the panelists put it, “The WikiLeaks events tee up the question of defining ‘media’ in the new, Internet era like no previous case.”
The Justice Department has said it is exploring possible charges against WikiLeaks and Assange in the release of diplomatic messages. Attorney General Eric Holder said charges may be brought under a World War I-era law, the Espionage Act of 1917 ( text here), or other laws.
In this written roundtable discussion, a diverse group of three panelists:
• Predict that Assange will be indicted and that the indictment will survive a legal challenge.
• Disagree on the question of whether Assange is a journalist. But they agree that even if he is deemed a journalist, that may not save him.
• Describe the prosecution's greatest weaknesses, starting with getting Assange onto U.S. soil for a trial.
• Discuss what may be an overwhelming handicap for the defense if there is a trial: Assange's personality. His statements that he intends to harm the United States won't help him with the judge. And a jury probably won't like him, the panelists predict.
Our panelists
Abbe D. Lowell ( full bio), a noted defense lawyer, is a Washington partner in the firm of McDermott Will & Emery. He represented one of the defendants in the case usually cited as the closest modern-day parallel to the WikiLeaks case, in which the government dropped charges against two lobbyists for a pro-Israel lobbying group accused of violating the Espionage Act by trafficking in government secrets. In addition to representing many high-profile defendants, he has served the government as chief minority counsel to the U.S. House during impeachment proceedings against President Bill Clinton and was special counselor to the United Nations in prosecution of human rights violations and war crimes in Rwanda and the former Yugoslavia.
Paul Rosenzweig ( full bio) served in the Department of Homeland Security under President George W. Bush as deputy assistant secretary for policy and as acting assistant secretary for international affairs. He's now at the Heritage Foundation as a visiting fellow at the Center for Legal and Judicial Studies. He lectures at the George Washington University School of Law and is co-author of the 2005 book " Winning the Long War: Lessons from the Cold War for Defeating Terrorism and Preserving Freedom."
Stephen I. Vladeck ( full bio) is a professor of law at American University Washington College of Law, where he teaches and writes on federal jurisdiction, constitutional law, national security law and international criminal law. He has been involved in several cases challenging U.S. government surveillance and detention of terrorism suspects and was part of the legal team that challenged the Bush administration's use of military tribunals at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, in the case Hamdan v. Rumsfeld.
Click through the eight questions here, and join the discussion in the comments section below.
Has Assange violated the Espionage Act?
The release of these diplomatic cables could not be more public, and about half of the 250,000 cables that WikiLeaks gave to newspapers are classified. Is there any doubt that Assange has violated the Espionage Act?
McDermott Will & Emery
Abbe D. Lowell
Abbe D. Lowell, defense attorney: There can be serious doubt, indeed, “reasonable doubt,” that Mr. Assange has violated the act. First, there has never been a prosecution under the act for a First Amendment-protected media outlet or reporter. The AIPAC case was the closest in that it charged lobbyists. [Lowell defended one of the lobbyists; the government dropped the charges.] It is not clear that a court would rule that the act can apply constitutionally in this context.
If a charge survived such a challenge, courts have then stated the government has a much higher burden of proof if First Amendment activity is involved — that burden requires the government prove beyond a reasonable doubt that Mr. Assange did the acts involved, did them with an intent to injure the U.S., and did them in bad faith. These are high bars in criminal cases.
So while it is not hard for a prosecutor to charge a case, obtaining a conviction is not assured.
American University
Stephen I. Vladeck
Stephen I. Vladeck, law professor, American University: There’s little doubt that Assange knowingly redistributed classified information. The doubt, such as it is, is whether the Espionage Act requires more.
The act, for example, prohibits the willful communication, delivery, or transmission to “any person not entitled to receive it” of “any document, writing, code book, signal book, sketch, photograph, photographic negative, blueprint, plan, map, model, instrument, appliance, or note relating to the national defense, or information relating to the national defense which information the possessor has reason to believe could be used to the injury of the United States or to the advantage of any foreign nation.” With regard to this last clause — that is, the disclosure of “information relating to the national defense” — courts have ruled that the defendant must have acted in “bad faith.” But what does that mean, here?
The single biggest problem with the Espionage Act is that its limits have never truly been tested, and so it is exceedingly difficult to say with any certainty what it does and doesn’t proscribe.
As the then-general counsel of the CIA summarized in 1979, “[o]n the one hand the laws stand idle and are not enforced at least in part because their meaning is so obscure, and on the other hand it is likely that the very obscurity of these laws serves to deter perfectly legitimate expression and debate by persons who must be as unsure of their liabilities as I am unsure of their obligations.”
Paul Rosenzweig, Heritage Foundation, former Homeland Security official: His actions seem to pretty readily fall within the strict terms of the act, but then so do those of The New York Times and dozens of other outlets.
The more interesting question is whether a violation of the act can be proven, given how the act has been interpreted. As recent failed efforts to prosecute two alleged recipients of classified material about Israel show, those prosecutions are fraught with challenges that make it hard to prove a violation beyond a reasonable doubt. Most notably, the courts have said that the act requires proof of some form of “specific intent” or “bad faith” for a conviction.
I think Assange’s assertion of a “good government/transparency” motive are patently self-serving flummery, but a jury might buy it.
I have no doubt that a colorable [seemingly valid] case can be made against Assange — but conviction is much less certain.
Does it matter that WikiLeaks didn't steal anything?
Does it matter that WikiLeaks is the recipient and distributor of stolen material, not the one who stole it?
American University
Stephen I. Vladeck
Stephen I. Vladeck, law professor, American University: It may matter quite a bit, both politically and for First Amendment reasons that I’ll get to in a second. But for starters, it’s quite clear that the Espionage Act applies on its face regardless of whether the individual who is distributing classified information is the initial thief or an intermediary. Indeed, the plain text of the statute would suggest that even the 100th person to redistribute the same classified document might still be liable, so long as he had the requisite mens rea [criminal intent]. For better or worse, classified information doesn’t become unclassified simply because it has been wrongly disclosed to the public.
That being said, in the 93-year history of the Espionage Act, the U.S. government has brought exactly one prosecution under the statute of anyone other than the initial thief/spy/leaker, and that case — concerning two American Israel Public Affairs Committee lobbyists accused of transmitting classified information to Israel — collapsed in 2009.
The elephant in the room here (as it was in the AIPAC case) is the First Amendment. Where information has already been leaked, there are many who believe that the First Amendment protects the right of Americans — journalists, in particular — to view and redistribute that information.
McDermott Will & Emery
Abbe D. Lowell
Abbe D. Lowell, defense attorney: As a technical and legal matter, each successive unauthorized disclosure of national defense (classified) information can be the basis of an Espionage Act prosecution, and so it would not prevent a charge against Mr. Assange.
But, his being a media recipient and distributor could matter in whether the Justice Department wants to bring such a theory that would be a precedent against all other media.
However, the government does not have to charge this conduct under the Espionage Act. The Attorney General has stated they are looking at other laws. Among these could be conspiracy, based on Mr. Assange being in an unlawful agreement with the person who actually stole the material, or the charge of theft of government property, which could apply to the person who stole the material and the person who “retains” it.
Paul Rosenzweig, Heritage Foundation, former Homeland Security official: Absolutely. We’ve successfully prosecuted many who have released classified material illegally — that’s how most spies are charged.
But because of First Amendment concerns, the U.S. has a very great hesitancy in punishing those who are the recipients of classified information and then republish it or transmit it onward. The Israeli case I mentioned above is the only such prosecution that I know of, and the government lost the case.
It may be that Assange can’t formally claim First Amendment protection — but it is certain that First Amendment principles and our history of protecting public discourse will cause the government to hesitate before prosecuting.
Is Assange a journalist?
Is Assange a journalist? Is WikiLeaks a news organization? If so, how does that affect a case? How is Assange any different from the newspapers that have republished the cables?
Paul Rosenzweig, Heritage Foundation, former Homeland Security official: I agree with Floyd Abrams (of Pentagon Papers fame). Like him, my opinion is that Assange is not a journalist and WikiLeaks is not a news organization.
News organizations pride themselves on adding value to news — they analyze and provide context. WikiLeaks does none of that. It’s more like a telephone directory — just a compiler of information, not a discriminating purveyor — and it demeans real news organizations to make the comparison.
Of course, Assange is sure to contest that conclusion if he is ever brought to trial, and the boundaries of the definition of a “news organization” in a complex Internet/blogging world have yet to be well drawn, so it is possible that a court will rule otherwise. But if I were a betting man I’d bet against this aspect of Assange’s defense.
McDermott Will & Emery
Abbe D. Lowell
Abbe D. Lowell, defense attorney: The issue of whether WikiLeaks is a media organization and whether Mr. Assange is a First Amendment protected journalist are key questions when dealing with the Espionage Act, because journalists and the media get the most protection at the intersection of the First Amendment to the criminal law and because the government has the highest burden of proof in this context.
The WikiLeaks events tee up the question of defining “media” in the new, Internet era like no previous case.
The government will argue that providing a website for the dissemination of raw classified data is “not reporting” and has no editorial or traditional media activity.
However, the First Amendment is very broad and very strong, and WikiLeaks has the better of the argument that gathering information (even raw information) and reporting it (disclosing it) is the classic definition of protected freedom of the press activity.
American University
Stephen I. Vladeck
Stephen I. Vladeck, law professor, American University: Legally, at least, I don’t think it matters whether or not Assange is a journalist or WikiLeaks is a news organization.
The Supreme Court has long resisted the invitation to recognize special constitutional protections for journalists, at least largely because it is so difficult to draw the line between the “mainstream media” and those private citizens who seek to publish information through other means, including blogs, Twitter feeds, or, if they still exist, pamphlets. In that sense, Assange may not be that different from The New York Times or other media outlets that have republished the cables. (Indeed, this will surely be one of his arguments.)
And I think this point goes a long way to explaining why this case is potentially so momentous. Although the U.S. government has never prosecuted a reporter or a newspaper for publishing classified information, the text of the Espionage Act would seem to permit such a prosecution, and several of the Supreme Court Justices who decided the Pentagon Papers case in 1971 specifically suggested that The Times and The Washington Post could be prosecuted after the fact for publishing the Pentagon Papers, even while ruling that they couldn’t be enjoined from publication.
So the real question is whether any prosecution of Assange would set a dangerous precedent for potential future prosecutions of the press, or whether the government would rely upon a novel theory that draws a clearer distinction between what Assange did here and what any number of newspapers have done both recently and in the past.
Is he protected by First Amendment?
As a non-citizen acting outside the United States, is Assange entitled to First Amendment protections at all? Should the First Amendment ever protect the public dissemination of classified material?
McDermott Will & Emery
Abbe D. Lowell
Abbe D. Lowell, defense attorney: Like so many other aspects of this case, whether and to what extent the First Amendment applies to a non-citizen who might be accused of making a disclosure (in other words a form of speech) abroad (and not in the U.S.) is not entirely clear. However, if the U.S. is able to get jurisdiction over Mr. Assange by claiming his actions occurred in the U.S., then he should be able to assert that the same activity enjoys the benefit of the First Amendment, because free speech and free press protections apply to people in the country, not just citizens.
The First Amendment does not have a broad carve-out from its free speech and free press protections for classified information or “national defense information” (the proper phrase under the Espionage Act). It would be inconsistent with the whole idea of such freedoms for there to be wholesale exceptions in the First Amendment for such categories. Instead, the First Amendment will compel a court to determine other aspects of any disclosure — the intent behind the release, the purpose of the disclosure and whether the disclosure was in “bad faith.” Those are where the First Amendment will or will not protect the conduct alleged here.
American University
Stephen I. Vladeck
Stephen I. Vladeck, law professor, American University: These are two very different questions. To the first, if it came to that point, Assange would be in the United States, sitting in a U.S. courtroom. Although the case law is decidedly unclear as to which rights non-citizens outside the United States are entitled to invoke, in that situation, I think Assange would have a very strong case that the First Amendment should apply.
But I doubt it will come to that. Because it is not even clear whether the Espionage Act applies to conduct that takes place overseas, I suspect that any Espionage Act prosecution would include an argument that some of the underlying acts took place within the territorial United States, even if it was simply the storage of some of these cables on servers physically located within the country. On that theory, if the crime happened “here,” I think it would be even clearer that Assange would be entitled to whatever protections the First Amendment would have to offer.
As to the second question, once we pull away all of the layers of the WikiLeaks onion, I think that this is the real issue for us to debate going forward. To be frank, I’m ambivalent about the answer. At the very least, though, it’s worth considering two sets of cases: (1) where the public good resulting from the disclosure clearly outweighs any potential harm to national security; and/or (2) where the disclosed information should not have been classified in the first place. In both sets of cases, I think there are compelling arguments in favor of allowing disclosure, or, at the very least, incentivizing a government employee to report misconduct to the appropriate government official in a whistleblowing case. And if the First Amendment doesn’t provide for such disclosure, perhaps a statute should. (Indeed, one of the many flaws in the Espionage Act as currently written is that it makes no exception for disclosures pursuant to federal whistleblower laws.)
Paul Rosenzweig, Heritage Foundation, former Homeland Security official: In general, no. Constitutional protections are only rarely extended to non-citizens and even more rarely applied outside of the United States, except in the context of when the U.S. government is an actor. Here it is certain that Assange will seek such protection, but doubtful whether he will get it.
It also may be irrelevant — the courts have resisted a formal distinction between the press and other publishers, so the First Amendment argument may be less than it seems.
As for the question of whether the First Amendment protects disclosure of classified information: Of course it does. It has for more than 200 years in one way or another. We still haven’t worked out exactly the right balance, but that is to be expected. Sometimes the disclosure will serve a positive purpose (think Pentagon Papers); other times it won’t (think Phillip Agee’s disclosure of the names of some of our covert CIA station chiefs), but that’s the price we pay for a robust democratic process and governmental transparency.
What hurdle does a prosecution face?
What is the greatest hurdle facing a prosecution? How might that be overcome?
American University
Stephen I. Vladeck
Stephen I. Vladeck, law professor, American University: To my mind, the greatest hurdle is the weight of history. As I noted above, a prosecution of Assange for violating the Espionage Act would be unprecedented.
So many key questions about the scope of the Espionage Act and the government’s burden of proof remain unanswered, that it would be impossible for even the most talented prosecutors to fully anticipate the legal issues that might arise.
And although the novelty of legal issues isn’t an argument against bringing a case, it will make things that much harder for any prosecution, the strategy of which may depend upon the answers to these as-yet-unanswered questions.
McDermott Will & Emery
Abbe D. Lowell
Abbe D. Lowell, defense attorney: The greatest hurdle to a prosecution will be a court deciding that the Espionage Act cannot be constitutionally applied to a First Amendment protected journalist or media outlet and that WikiLeaks and Assange get that protection.
A second great hurdle will be the higher burden of proof (intent to injure the U.S. and bad faith) if the case gets past a motion to dismiss.
There will be the additional obstacles of extradition of Mr. Assange to the U.S. (it is not automatic) and also whether other laws (like the theft of government property) can apply to someone who received the information.
The government can overcome these hurdles by distinguishing WikiLeaks from mainstream media, by using Mr. Assange’s various press statements to show he did indeed have an intent to harm the U.S., and by using statutes other than the Espionage Act to charge him.
Paul Rosenzweig, Heritage Foundation, former Homeland Security official: It seems highly unlikely that Assange will ever face trial in this country, because no country where he is located is likely to extradite him the America.
Extradition for “political offenses” is rare, and Sweden has a long history of granting political asylum/refusing political extradition. Only extreme diplomatic pressure (of a form I cannot readily imagine being actually applied) would be likely to compel the Swedes to yield him up for trial. The British might be more willing to extradite him, and our extradition treaty with them might cover these offenses. One would hope that the Administration does not delay its extradition request until after Assange moves to a less-favorable jurisdiction.
In truth, I see this as a very high hurdle, and have trouble envisioning how it would be overcome.
What is the defense weakness?
What is the greatest weakness of a defense? How might that be overcome?
Paul Rosenzweig, Heritage Foundation, former Homeland Security official: From a thematic point of view Assange seems like he would be a pretty unappealing defendant. In his public appearances he comes across as self-righteous and arrogant. There is more than a little hint of anti-Americanism in his rhetoric.
And his “supporters” today in the hacktivist anarchic community are adopting a scorched earth strategy that will rub off on Assange, to his detriment.
If he ever comes to trial, the jury will not like him. The obvious way to overcome it is to make him act more likeably — I wonder if that would be possible.
McDermott Will & Emery
Abbe D. Lowell
Abbe D. Lowell, defense attorney: The greatest hurdle for the defense will be that the facts themselves — that huge data dumps of raw classified material will not be deemed to be covered by the First Amendment.
Close behind will be that neither Assange nor the type of large disclosure he did (as well as his public statements) will inspire sympathy from a judge ruling on the case or a trial jury deciding whether they like his conduct or him. He stands a serious risk that a court or jury will want to find ways to convict him.
He might overcome these obstacles by having the mainstream media and their legal groups take up his cause that he is protected by the First Amendment, by showing that what he did is not different that what other media have been doing in publishing the same material, and by moderating some of his press comments not to play into the hands of any prosecution.
American University
Stephen I. Vladeck
Stephen I. Vladeck, law professor, American University: Some of the biggest issues for the defense may well arise out of statements Assange has already made publicly.
If the prosecution boils down to whether Assange acted in bad faith, and whether he reasonably should have known that these disclosures would harm U.S. national security, he may have hurt his own cause by being so publicly forthright throughout this controversy, especially with regard to the effects of future leaks. If Assange’s publicly stated goal is to bring down incumbent administrations, banks, and the like, it may be hard for the defense to portray him as someone who didn’t appreciate the harm that might result from the disclosures.
And if that weren’t enough, the U.S. government tried very hard to make sure he was on notice, with letters to Assange from both the State Department’s legal adviser and the Defense Department’s general counsel underlining the point prior to the latest round of disclosures.
How should the U.S. change the Espionage Act?
How should the U.S. deal with future Assanges? What should Congress do in response to this case in writing an Espionage Act of 2011?
McDermott Will & Emery
Abbe D. Lowell
Abbe D. Lowell, defense attorney: I was able to submit testimony in May 2010 [ read the testimony here in a PDF file] on whether and how the Espionage Act should be amended. It is long overdue for changes.
No law should be changed to respond to a single person’s action, and a great deal of careful thought and debate would be required before a new law is passed so that true national security is balanced with precious constitutional rights.
However, any new statute should at least:
• Carefully define espionage differently than a separate offense for the improper disclosure of national defense information (NDI) and separately from the improper handing or disclosure of classified information that may or may not be NDI.
• Make clear that the statute only applies to NDI that is shown to be “closely held.” There are occasions when information is so available and pervasive that it can no longer be said to be “closely held.”
• Define the criminal intent needed for a conviction of each offense in terms that are clear (i.e., with a specific intent to injure the national defense of the U.S. without regard to whether it helps a foreign country) so people can conform their conduct and judges and juries can apply the law consistently.
• Make clear how the law covers tangible (documents or data) as well as non-tangible information (oral conversations) in a manner that protects First Amendment activity and whether and how, in the context of “leak,” it should ever be applied to those who are not government officials, such as the media.
American University
Stephen I. Vladeck
Stephen I. Vladeck, law professor, American University: Long before WikiLeaks was on our radar screen, there was already a concerted effort to modernize the Espionage Act, and the WikiLeaks affair should only reinforce calls for reform.
But reform should not just be a knee-jerk reaction to Assange. Instead, Congress should consider three distinct sets of issues in “updating” the Espionage Act:
• Clarifying the circumstances in which the Espionage Act does apply to third-parties, and not just the original spy/thief/leaker, including whether the same mens rea [criminal intent] applies in those cases.
• Including specific exemptions from the Espionage Act for disclosures that are covered by federal whistleblower laws.
• Considering the addition of a defense to the Espionage Act for cases in which the relevant material was improperly classified.
This is just the tip of the iceberg — the Espionage Act regime as a whole is antiquated, outdated, and could benefit from a complete reworking. But at the very least, these steps might help clarify some of the most difficult legal issues that a prosecution of Assange might raise.
Paul Rosenzweig, Heritage Foundation, former Homeland Security official: It’s tough to draw a statute that is both consistent with our tradition of transparency in government and yet punishes those, like Assange, who seem clearly to have transgressed. That’s why moves for an American equivalent of an Official Secrets Act (from the UK) have been routinely rejected — including a relatively recent effort by Senator [Richard] Shelby [R-Ala.].
I think it is time for a careful reconsideration of the Espionage Act, to include some serious thinking about the following questions:
• Are Internet releases different from journalism?
• Is proof of specific intent to harm a reasonable requirement?
• Is stolen information equivalent to stolen property?
• How do we protect legitimate press activity or whistleblowers?
More broadly, the more profitable effort will be on the defensive side. It seems rather problematic that our classified systems have not been configured to detect and create alerts for prima facie [apparently illegal] policy violations automatically, as for example when files with certain attributes are transmitted outside the host organization or large volumes of material are downloaded. Nor apparently, have our systems been configured to alert on anomalies, such as the accessing of sensitive data inconsistent with normal usage patterns. One way for Congress to deal with future Assanges is for it to make the Executive Branch step up to the plate on information assurance.
Will he be indicted or convicted?
Prediction time: What is the likelihood of a U.S. indictment of Assange? What is the likelihood of an indictment surviving a motion to dismiss? What is the likelihood of a conviction if a case went to trial?
Paul Rosenzweig, Heritage Foundation, former Homeland Security official:
Indictment: 80% likely (it’s a political necessity).
Surviving a motion to dismiss: 80 percent (if it is a carefully drawn indictment).
Assange being extradited to the US for trial: 10-20 percent (precisely because it’s a political necessity in the US!).
Assange being convicted if he is tried: 60-70 percent (I don’t think a jury will be very sympathetic).
Bonus prediction: Some of Assange’s supporting hacktivists are identified, arrested, extradited, tried and ultimately convicted: 70-80 percent.
Abbe D. Lowell, defense attorney: The WikiLeaks disclosures are getting bolder and causing more controversy; the U.S. will find some way to bring charges (under the Espionage Act and/or other laws), because not doing so will be deemed bad legal precedent, bad foreign relations, and bad national politics.
A well-crafted, narrow indictment will not be dismissed because a court will probably rule that there is no absolute First Amendment bar to charging an entity like WikiLeaks for the kind of data dump it did and that the legal issues involved in the case (criminal intent, higher protection) require a trial.
A conviction will depend entirely on how jury instructions are drafted by a court (how high is the First Amendment bar) and whether a jury decides to follow those instructions (a jury in some area, perhaps Alexandria, Virginia, may decide the case differently than one in D.C.).
American University
Stephen I. Vladeck
Stephen I. Vladeck, law professor, American University: Honestly, I have no idea.
I suspect that some of what happens here may depend upon what happens in the pending criminal case against him in Sweden. So long as the Swedish criminal process is running its course, we may well hold off on pursuing Assange (even if an indictment has already been obtained).
But if, for whatever reason, the case against Assange there doesn’t produce a conviction, I think it is extremely likely that the U.S. government will pursue an indictment (or unseal an indictment it has already obtained), and seek Assange’s extradition.
And I suspect that, at that point, the case would be strong enough to survive a motion to dismiss.
As for the likelihood of a conviction, that’s ultimately a question for twelve unknown citizens.

description.hltext_display: Confirma Segob 28 muertes por explosión en San Martín Texmelucan
North State in Brief: Dec. 22, 2010
description.content:
Two arrested
after carjacking
Two people have been arrested in connection with a kidnapping and carjacking earlier this month in Redding.
Javier Rodriguez, 47, of Reno, was arrested Monday on suspicion of kidnapping and carjacking in connection with an incident Dec. 8 near Canyon Road and Highway 273, Redding police said Tuesday.
Melissa Brown, 36, of Anderson, reported to police that a man got into her car near the intersection, pretended to point a weapon at her, took her cell phone and ordered her to drive, police said.
Two days later police discovered Brown’s gold 1999 Pontiac Sunfire at a motel in Anderson when they arrested Debbie Belt, 28, of Cottonwood, on an outstanding warrant, officers said.
On Dec. 17, police obtained a warrant charging Rodriguez with kidnapping, carjacking, robbery, terrorist threats and vehicle theft.
About 2 a.m. Monday, police were called to a report of a “suspicious person” at the Safeway store on Cypress Avenue in Redding. They found Rodriguez and arrested him on suspicion of being under the influence of a controlled substance and providing a false identity to police.
He was booked into the Shasta County jail. Belt also was booked on charges of possessing stolen property and vehicle theft. Both were being held without bail.
Two schools will
get new principals
Juniper Elementary School in Redding is getting a new principal.
Brad Clagg, who had been principal at Meadow Lane Elementary School in Anderson, will be taking over as principal at Juniper some time in January, according to Redding School District Superintendent Diane Kempley.
Margaret Arthofer, who had been principal at Juniper for the past 3½ years, is the new director for instructional improvement with the Shasta County Office of Education.
Clagg had been principal at Meadowlane for 11 years. Before then, he taught at Juniper and Sequoia Middle School in Redding.
Cascade Union School District Superintendent Mike Michelon said district officials are in the process of recruiting and hiring a new principal for Meadow Lane.
Justice center
gets $5,000 grant
The Shasta Family Justice Center recently received a $5,000 grant from The California Endowment to help provide services for victims of family violence.
The center has seen more than 300 visitors since it opened in August, said Executive Director Michael Burke.
The grant will help pay for the center’s daily services, which include providing victims with food, clothing, phones, legal assistance, court support and more.
Computer classes
offered to adults
Shasta Senior Nutrition Programs will hold weekly winter computer classes for adults 55 and older beginning Jan. 5.
Spots are available in the Introduction to Microsoft Office class and the Internet class.
Classes are one hour long and meet every week for eight weeks at the SSNP facility, 100 Mercy Oaks Drive in Redding.
There is an $8 material fee.
For more information or to enroll, call SSNP at 226-3060.

El Grupo Iruña quiere seguir colgado de la ilusión
description.content:
Los navarros reciben al todopoderoso Murcia (20.30 horas, Anaitasuna)
Cada socio podrá llevar a otra persona gratis a este importante encuentro
votos comentarios
compartir (¿qué es esto?)
Sanborn realiza un espectacular mate.
Vista:
Más texto
Más visual
Galería Noticia
Pamplona. Si alguien se hubiese atrevido a asegurar que el Grupo Iruña iba a llevar a estas alturas de la temporada nueve victorias y estuviese situado en la quinta posición de la tabla se le hubiese tildado de loco. Pero así ha sido y los de Jareño se encuentran en un momento espectacular e inimaginable, después de cuatro victorias consecutivas, para recibir esta tarde (20.30 horas, Anaitasuna) a uno de los equipos más poderosos de la categoría, el Murcia, recién descendido de ACB. El club ha querido premiar a los socios y podrán llevar otra persona gratis.
Mucho que ganar y poco que perder. Eso es lo que tiene el Grupo Iruña para el encuentro de esta tarde. El equipo de Jareño lleva toda la semana entrenando muy concentrados y con muchas ganas de sorprender al todopoderoso Murcia. El entrenador de los navarros cuenta con todos sus efectivos disponibles y con la moral alta (aunque nunca eufóricos, que es algo que controla mucho el preparador madrileño) tras granar cuatro partidos consecutivos a rivales de entidad como el Clínicas Rincón en su casa.
Pero lo que viene esta tarde al Anaitasuna es el más difícil todavía. Un equipo recién descendido de ACB que cuenta con jugadores internacionales con sus selecciones y con un gran pasado en la máxima categoría. Además es el único equipo de la LEB Oro que todavía no ha perdido fuera de su casa, por lo que todavía es una presa de mayor entidad para el equipo de Jareño.
Para la posición de base, Luis Guil, no tiene un buen director de juego, tiene para elegir entre tres. Pedro Rivero, que ascendió la temporada pasada llevando el timonel del CAI, Xavi Puyada, un dominador histórico de la categoría, y Óscar González, que tiene en su palmarés dos ascensos a la ACB y dos copas príncipe.
Por si esto fuera poco, la batería exterior de los murcianos es tremenda. Primero cuenta con Michael Umeh, un escolta que está considerado como el jugador con más talento de la liga. Para acompañarle están Pedro Robles y Sergio Pérez Anagnostou, dos jugadores que han sido campeones del concurso de triples de la ACB. Para terminar cuentan con Juan Ignacio Jasen (hermano de Pancho, capitán del Estudiantes) que tiene un leve esguince de tobillo pero todo indica que será de la partida seguro.
Poderío interior Pero si por fuera son un equipo con una calidad excelsa, en la zona el Murcia es un equipo poderosísimo. Taylor Coppenrath es la principal referencia de los hombres grandes del Murcia, aunque si el tiene un mal día puede aparecer Taj Gray, que ha jugado los últimos tres partidos después de salir de una lesión, que es su acompañante en la zona y que tiene multitud de recursos en ataque. En el banquillo esperarán Victor Faverani, el cual será duda hasta el último instante ya que está atravesando un proceso gripal, y Roberto Morentín. El primero es un joven de 2,12 de la cantera de Unicaja que parece haber encaminado su carrera en Murcia después de unos años dubitativos. El segundo es un veterano ala-pívot que tiene un letal tiro de tres.
Así pues, un rival muy peligroso que necesita esta victoria para que no se le escape el Xacobeo por lo que será difícil arrebatarle la victoria. Pero un Grupo Iruña que está montado en una ola de ilusión puede dar más de un susto a los murcianos.
Además, para ayudar a los jugadores, el club ha querido premiar a los socios y estos podrán llevar a una persona gratis al pabellón. Un partido con nivel ACB en el que Grupo Iruña tiene mucho que ganar y muy poco que perder. Un encuentro para disfrutar.

description.hltext_display: 保税港区信息系统投入使用
description.content:
羊城晚报讯 20日，广东省技术最先进、功能最齐全、起点最高的信息系统———保税港区信息系统在南沙保税港投入使用。该系统启动后，通过广州电子口岸进行数据交换和共享，实现保税港区货物“一次申报、一次查验、一次放行”的业务操作模式，促进保税物流与口岸物流一体化运作，加快通关速度，降低企业成本，企业进出口货物更加方便。
（黄丽娜 南宣）
黄丽娜、南宣

宗教局:我天主教选举领导人不需梵蒂冈“恩准”
description.content:
国家宗教事务局发言人就梵蒂冈指责中国天主教第八次代表会议发表谈话
新华网北京12月22日电 国家宗教事务局发言人22日就梵蒂冈发表声明指责中国天主教第八次代表会议一事发表谈话。
发言人说，12月17日，梵蒂冈新闻室公开发表声明，指责前不久召开的中国天主教第八次代表会议，攻击中国宗教信仰自由政策。梵蒂冈的这一行为不仅非常冒失，而且十分无理。
中国天主教代表会议是团结全国天主教徒、民主讨论教会发展途径、共商服务社会大计的重要组织形式。50多年来，中国天主教先后召开了八次全国代表会议，为推动中国天主教健康发展，服务祖国现代化建设，都发挥了重要作用。
中国天主教爱国会、中国天主教主教团是依法登记的合法社会团体，依据《社会团体登记管理条例》规定，每5年召开代表会议，修改章程，选举产生领导机构，确定工作任务和行动目标。中国天主教代表会议制度不涉及天主教教义问题，不违背天主教基本信仰，不存在其他国家或外国组织承认与否的问题。
中国宪法规定，中国公民享有宗教信仰自由权利，同时宗教团体和宗教事务不受外国势力支配。按照这一规定，中国各宗教包括天主教坚持独立自主自办的原则。中国天主教第八次代表会议审议通过的《中国天主教爱国会章程》和《中国天主教主教团章程》规定：中国天主教会“在政治、经济和教会事务上坚持独立自主自办原则，维护国家主权和教会事务自主权，与社会主义社会相适应”，在《中国天主教主教团章程》中还规定：“在信仰及福传事业上，依据主耶稣基督对宗徒们的派遣和圣神赋予宗徒们的权力，履行牧职使命，在当信当行的教义教规上，与宗徒之长伯多禄的继承人保持共融。”但在梵蒂冈新闻室发表的声明中声称，“独立自主自办教会及民主办教原则与天主教教义是无法调和的”，这是对中国天主教现状的误解，不知是他们根本没有看到章程规定，还是故意混淆政治与信仰的界限。梵蒂冈的政治立场是尽人皆知的，试图借宗教信仰推行政治理念，这是十分危险的，将对中国天主教在中国的健康发展带来严重危害。
代表会议制度是中国天主教在探索民主办教实践中形成的，中国政府予以充分尊重。近两三年来，梵蒂冈通过各种方式阻止中国天主教代表会议的召开，对参加会议的神职人员代表以“惩罚”进行威胁。到底是谁用强制手段对待宗教信仰，是谁要求天主教徒违背自己的“良心”，难道不是十分清楚吗？这让我们想起新中国刚建立时的那一幕，梵蒂冈驻华代表发出“指令”，要求中国天主教拒绝与新生政权合作。历史是那么相似，但时代毕竟进步了，固守旧思维已经办不成什么事情了。
中国天主教第八次代表会议选举产生了中国天主教爱国会和中国天主教主教团新一届领导机构，主要负责人都是高票当选，体现了与会代表的意愿和期盼，可谓众望所归。梵蒂冈新闻室声明却对他们进行谴责，这是对中国天主教会广大神长教友民主意愿的粗暴践踏和蔑视，是极其蛮横和无礼的行径。难道中国的宗教社会团体选举领导人，还要外国组织“钦定”或者“恩准”吗？
近年来，为了改善中梵关系，中方以极大诚意与梵方进行坦诚、建设性对话，寻求改善关系的途径和方式。但梵蒂冈总有一些人在关键时刻出来干扰，无休止地提出无理要求，阻挠双方改善关系的进程，此次破坏中国天主教代表会议，就是最新的典型例子。梵蒂冈还在接触商谈的同时，以公开和秘密方式干涉中国天主教内部事务，试图重新控制中国天主教会。中梵关系出现当前这种令人遗憾的局面，责任完全在梵方。
发言人说，中国政府改善中梵关系的原则是明确的，态度是真诚的。近年来，中方为改善中梵关系，在言论上一直保持克制，希望营造一个良好环境。但梵蒂冈的媒体以及有关人员，不断发表攻击性言论。我们的克制不等于可以放弃原则和底线，希望梵蒂冈谨言慎行，自我约束，不要再恶化双方关系，回到对话的正确轨道上来。

description.hltext_display: Accord Europe/Etats-Unis sur les crédits export à l'aéronautique
description.content:
L?accord entre europe et états-unis sur les crédits export à l'aéronautique aurait été conclu
PARIS (Reuters) - Le nouvel accord international sur les crédits export à l'aéronautique, finalisé vendredi à Paris après plusieurs mois de négociations au sein de l'OCDE, a été approuvé mardi par les Etats-Unis, rapportent mercredi Les Echos.
Cet accord vise à rétablir l'équilibre entre les compagnies des pays exportateurs d'avions et leurs concurrents des pays tiers, tout en protégeant les exportations d'Airbus, filiale d'EADS, et de Boeing, écrit le quotidien.
Malgré quelques demandes américaines de dernière minute, le texte final, applicable à partir du 1er février, reste néanmoins conforme au compromis négocié la semaine dernière, précise le journal.
"Cependant, comme le demandaient Airbus et Boeing, cet accord prévoit une période de transition durant laquelle un certain nombre d'avions continueront à échapper à cette hausse des primes", poursuivent Les Echos.
"Ce sera le cas pour tous les appareils commandés avant le 31 décembre et livrés avant fin 2012, ainsi que pour 69 Boeing et autant d'Airbus commandés avant 2007 et qui continueront à bénéficier de taux encore plus bas que les conditions actuelles."
Alexandre Boksenbaum-Granier, édité par Dominique Rodriguez
FERMER X
Crédit : REUTERS
L?accord entre europe et états-unis sur les crédits export à l'aéronautique aurait été conclu
Le nouvel accord international sur les crédits export à l'aéronautique, finalisé vendredi à Paris après plusieurs mois de négociations au sein de l'OCDE, a été approuvé mardi par les Etats-Unis, selon Les Echos. /Photo d'archives/REUTERS/Alessandro Bianchi

description.hltext_display: � 朝阳：观望微博平台开放 视频网站不能比纯
description.content:
微博的娱乐基因
“搜狐有搜狐的基因，在这个土壤上成长出的微博跟新浪是不同的。我们还是坚持名人战略不变，先从娱乐入手。”
在娱乐圈深耕已久的搜狐，正在微博上尝试一条差异化道路，领路人是和两岸文娱名人打成一片的 “狐总”张朝阳。
从11月份开始，搜狐CEO张朝阳亲自上阵拉人的报道频频见诸报端，赵本山、孙红雷、李连杰、安以轩等好友在他的召唤下纷纷开通搜狐微博。11月中旬，张朝阳登门拜访了上海海派清口演员周立波，并成功邀请到对方入驻。
目前看来，两人的关系不错。12月20日，张朝阳特地赶到上海参加了周的婚礼，给足面子。明星云集的婚礼过后，搜狐微博又迎来了主持界的“常青树”敬一丹。
“是崔永元把敬一丹拉过来的，他跟她宣传我们，教她怎么用。这就是‘群体效应’，通过名人间的互动，把用户量迅速拉上去。”
张朝阳透露，从11月至今的一个多月内，搜狐微博的用户量已经翻了三番，但他没有透露其他数据。“能翻三番是因为本身的基数还比较小。最开始的时候用户数字‘不堪入目’，接下来就看发展态势了。”
开放平台并非必须
张朝阳说，在整天泡在微博的这段时间，对其独特生长形态的认识又多了一些。
“搜狐为什么突然奋起要再造，是因为作为一个以媒体起家的公司正在面临着WEB2.0的冲击，从内容渠道到消费渠道都有变化。
内容上来说，以前都是传统媒体在做，现在越来越多来自微博，名人写微博本身就是内容；消费渠道的话，以前是直接登录网站比较多，现在发现来自搜索引擎、微博、社区等方面的转发、推荐比较多。搜狐媒体平台要应对这样的变化。微博的生长形态具有很强的SNS特征，它是一个开放的网。”
不过，张朝阳对微博平台的开放仍抱观望态度。
“新浪微博在尝试开放平台，但这对搜狐来说还为时过早，首先是因为我们的规模还没达到，此外我认为微博始终应该是轻型应用，不应承载太多功能或接口。”
张朝阳说，“开放平台并不是微博的必经之路，也许新浪有他们的考虑，但对搜狐微博来说，这路还是要走得谨慎一点。”
谈到其他推广问题时，张朝阳表示，现阶段搜狐微博还不会进入到二三线城市的地面推广，“最重要的是先把一线城市做透，至于其他微博开展的地推活动，让他们先宣传吧，帮整个微博市场铺铺路。”
视频网站不能比“纯”
12月8日，优酷网在美国纽交所上市。在随后的媒体访谈中，口气随公司市值而涨的优酷CEO古永锵认为，优酷能成功上市是因为比其他媒体公司更“纯”，是一家专职经营视频的公司。古永锵甚至提出，什么都要插一脚的互联网公司会造成行业的混乱。
张朝阳显然不同意这一表述，“也许华尔街认同这个说法，但从我们的角度来看是不能理解的。”
“对广告主来说，无论是在推广还是营销上，一个全方位的媒体平台具有垂直视频网站无法比拟的媒体平台优势。其次，中国市场上还是要看（网络）长视频的力量，拼的是资金实力、媒体平台，上市可以帮助公司打仗，但竞争状态还远远不够。”
张朝阳特别透露，搜狐视频2011年计划在购买正版内容方面的资金约在2亿元左右，而该项投入在2010年刚超过1亿元。

description.hltext_display: Миронова ужаснули петербургские сосульки
description.content: САНКТ-ПЕТЕРБУРГ, 22 декабря. Спикер Совета Федерации Сергея Миронова приводит в ужас то, что он читает в Интернете о ситуации с уборкой города в Петербурге. Об этом он сообщил журналистам в ходе посещения Северо-Западного государственного заочного технического университета.

description.hltext_display: La primera vuelta de Triman tiene premio
description.content:
Este año, sí. Tras una muy buena primera vuelta de campeonato, y después de dos temporadas sin hacerlo, Triman Navarra volverá a disputar la fase final de una Copa de España, que celebrará su 22ª edición y se jugará en el polideportivo Pedro Delgado de Segovia del 3 al 6 de febrero.
El conjunto navarro ha ocupado posiciones de Copa durante casi toda la primera vuelta, pero dos derrotas seguidas frente a ElPozo de Murcia y Talavera pusieron en en serio peligro estar en Segovia. Pero al final, y tras ganar al Gestesa Guadalajara y aprovecharse de las derrotas de Benicarló y Sala10 Zaragoza, Triman Navarra acabó la primera vuelta en sexta posición y selló su presencia en el torneo del k.o.
Además, con los 24 puntos conseguidos por los de Irurtzun se estuvo cerca igualar el récord histórico del club en la primera mitad de un campeonato, que se sitúa en 25. La victoria frente al Barcelona o los empates contra Inter o Lobelle son los resultados más destacados de los subcampeones de Liga durante las primeras 15 jornadas, en las que han demostrado oficio y madurez como para estar entre los mejores de División de Honor.
sexta participación Desde que el Club Deportivo Xota lograra el ascenso a División de Honor en la temporada 1997-1998, los de Irurtzun han participado en cinco ediciones de la Copa de España -Valencia 2002, Navarra 2005, Zaragoza 2006, Lugo 2007 y Cuenca 2008-.
Sólo tres temporadas en División de Honor le bastaron al Xota para conseguir debutar en su primera Copa de España. Y a punto estuvieron de meterse en semifinales, pero finalmente cayeron en la prórroga de cuartos ante el Caja Segovia (2-1).
Sí llegaron al penúltimo partido tres temporadas después, cuando los verdes fueron los organizadores de la fase final de 2005. Después de ganar al Playas de Castellón en un partido épico, los navarros, que podían meterse en Europa si pasaban a la final, fueron apeados por el Azkar de Lugo en semifinales.
Contra la misma barrera se estrellaron en la edición de Lugo 2007, cuando tras ganar en cuartos al multimillonario Polaris World Cartagena (3-5) cayeron en semifinales ante ElPozo de Murcia (5-3). En las otras dos participaciones no se pudo superar el partido inicial de cuartos y los verdugos fueron el Lobelle de Santiago (2-4 en 2008) y el Martorell (2-3 en 2006).
Así, tras unos primeros años de contacto con División de Honor, Triman Navarra se hizo uno de los habituales en las fases finales de la Copa -desde 2005 fue consecutivamente a cuatro ediciones-. Sin embargo, en las dos últimas temporadas falló a su cita al quedar fuera de los ocho primeros puestos al final de la primera vuelta. Ahora, los de Irurtzun volverán a estar ahí, en la competición del k.o. Un premio a una muy buena primera vuelta.

description.hltext_display: Riesengagen bei Radio gaga Von Nina Rehfeld, Phoenix
description.author: Nina Rehfeld, Phoenix
description.content:
Der amerikanische Hörfunk ist populär wie nie zuvor. Wer hier am lautesten schreit, am deftigsten flucht oder aufwiegelt, kann Hunderte Millionen Dollar verdienen. Aber wie finanzieren die Sender Gagen bis zur halben Milliarde?
Der Satellitensender Sirius XM finanziert die Gagen mit Abonnements: Hier als Gast im New Yorker Studio die Sängerin Faith Evans
Die Summen klingen, als ginge es um Superstars der amerikanischen Basketball-Liga oder um prominente Golfer: Für vierhundert Millionen Dollar hat Howard Stern kürzlich seinen Arbeitsvertrag bei dem Abo-Radiosender SiriusXM um weitere fünf Jahre verlängert. Das ist viermal so viel, wie den L.A. Lakers ihr Top-Athlet Kobe Bryant wert ist. Auch andere Radiopersönlichkeiten stellen die Megaverdienste von Amerikas höchstbezahlten Sportlern in den Schatten: Rush Limbaugh sitzt auf einem Achtjahresvertrag im Wert von fünfhundert Millionen Dollar (inklusive Bonus) beim Syndikationssender Premiere Radio Networks, der Moderator Sean Hannity unterschrieb ebendort 2008 einen Vertrag über fünf Jahre, der ihm hundert Millionen Dollar einbringt.
Die Radiosender investieren diese Riesensummen in berühmt-berüchtigte Meinungsmacher und sogenannte „Shock Jocks“, weil die Großmäuler ein Millionenpublikum versammeln. Für Privatsender, bei denen Limbaugh und Hannity unter Vertrag sind, bedeutet das hohe Werbeeinnahmen, vor allem aber lukrative, weitreichende Syndikationsverträge mit zahllosen Lokalstationen, die ihr Programm nur zum Teil selbst produzieren und ansonsten mit eingekauften Erfolgsshows gestalten. Für kostenpflichtige Satellitensender wie Sirius XM, die nur für Abonnenten zugänglich sind, bilden prominente Persönlichkeiten wie Howard Stern, aber auch Oprah Winfrey und Martha Stewart die Zugpferde, um Abopreise zwischen zehn und siebzehn Dollar monatlich verlangen zu können, so finanzieren sich die monströsen Gagen.
Emotionsgeladene Rechthaberei, pointierte Meinungsverstärkung
Konservativer Gastgeber: Rush "Ditto" Limbaugh, ausnahmsweise ohne dicke Zigarre
Europäern mag das Radio als Medium der Vergangenheit erscheinen, in den Vereinigten Staaten hat es durch den Aufstieg des populären „Talk Radio“ und die Deregulierung der amerikanischen Medienlandschaft in den vergangenen zwanzig Jahren eine triumphale Renaissance erlebt. 1987 verwarf die amerikanische Medienbehörde FCC mit Hinweis auf die freie Meinungsäußerung die „Fairness Doctrine“, der zufolge kontroverse Themen im öffentlichen Rundfunk unparteiisch, ehrlich und aus verschiedenen Blickwinkeln darzustellen seien, und im folgenden Jahr gab ein junger Hitzkopf namens Rush Limbaugh dem ehrwürdigen Polit-Talk im Radio als polternd-rechthaberische One-Man-Show ein neues Gewand.
Limbaugh legte den Grundstein für ein rasend populäres Genre, das die politische Kultur der Vereinigten Staaten entscheidend verändern sollte. Der Erfolg von Fox News und von Figuren wie Sarah Palin gründet auf Limbaugh, der emotionsgeladene Rechthaberei und pointierte Meinungsverstärkung zum gestalterischen Prinzip machte. „Dittoheads“ werden seine Anhänger genannt, er hatte seine Hörer ermuntert, einfach „ditto“ zu sagen, so sie seine Show goutierten. Inzwischen ist das ein stehender Begriff. Ein „Dittohead“ ist jemand, der Limbaughs schlichte Sicht der Welt, die er stets in Schwarz und Weiß zu teilen weiß, ohne Wenn und Aber übernimmt.
„Ich hoffe, Obama scheitert“
Die Medienaufsicht FCC konzentrierte sich in den folgenden zwei Jahrzehnten statt auf politische Ausgewogenheit auf die Wahrung des öffentlichen Anstands. Als Howard Stern 2005 für unerhörte fünfhundert Millionen Dollar auf fünf Jahre zum Satellitensender Sirius wechselte, war er der böse Bube des öffentlichen Rundfunks; ein Mann, der seine Arbeitgeber 2,5 Millionen Dollar Bußgelder für unflätige Äußerungen gekostet hatte und ein Publikum von bis zu zwanzig Millionen Hörern mit gezielten Unaussprechlichkeiten, zumeist sexueller Natur, bannte.
Stern behauptet zwar, er erreiche auch im Satellitenradio - nach der Fusion von Sirius und dem Konkurrenten XM sind dort zwanzig Millionen Hörer dabei - zwölf Millionen Menschen, aber Experten schätzen die Zahl auf eher zwei Millionen. Das würde Sterns Riesengehalt immer noch amortisieren. Die Annahme, dass sein Schockwert dem Sender weiteren Zulauf beschert, wird indes dadurch entkräftigt, dass dieser sich vor allem aus den Kontroversen mit der FCC speiste. Diesen Kitzel gibt es im Satellitenradio nicht.
Unterdessen setzt man auch im frei empfangbaren Privatradio, das sich durch Werbung, nicht durch Abogebühren finanziert, erfolgreich auf Breitband-Provokation, hier politischer Natur. Limbaugh ähnelt einem verrückt gewordenem Prediger, er flottiert frei zwischen scharfem politischem Kommentar und offener Demagogie („Ich hoffe, Obama scheitert“), nach eigenen Angaben erreicht er ein Publikum von zwanzig Millionen Hörern pro Woche. Wie hoch die Zahl tatsächlich liegt, können Experten nur schätzen - zwischen fünfzehn und fünfundzwanzig Millionen seien es, mutmaßt die „Washington Post“, weil Limbaughs Sendung auf mehr als 600 frei empfangbaren kleinen Privatstationen zu hören ist. Und die zahlen jeweils Lizenzgebühren an den Sender Premiere Radio Networks.
Ein gewisse Kampfeslust wird durchaus geschätzt
Beschert dem Sender mit seinem Schockwert Zuhörer: Der böse Bube Howard Stern mit seiner Frau Beth Ostrosky
Man muss nicht unbedingt ein Sprücheklopfer sein, um amerikanischen Radiosendern Gold wert zu sein. Auch der Sonnyboy Ryan Seacrest, der „American Idol“ moderiert und eine zentrale Figur der amerikanischen Entertainmentlandschaft ist, hat gerade seinen Radiovertrag mit dem Privatsender Clear Channel um drei Jahre verlängert, gegen eine Gage von sechzig Millionen Dollar - sie ist nahezu doppelt so hoch wie sein bisheriges Salär von fünfunddreißig Millionen Dollar. Seacrest moderiert im Radio unter anderem die Musiksendung „American Top 40“ und „On air with Ryan Seacrest“, die Sendungen sind weltweit auf mehr als fünfhundert Radiostationen zu hören.
Doch auf dem amerikanischen Binnenmarkt wird eine gewisse Kampfeslust durchaus geschätzt. Provokation und Kontroverse bürgen für Erfolg. Als Don Imus vor drei Jahren für einen rassistischen Kommentar aus dem Hiphop-Slang von CBS entlassen wurde, strengte er gegen den Sender eine Klage an - mit dem Hinweis, das sein Arbeitsvertrag „kontroverses und respektloses Verhalten“ von ihm verlangte.
Und derzeit steigen erfolgreiche Radiotalker wie Sean Hannity und Glenn Beck mit übler Stimmungsmache gegen Barack Obama („Obama ist ein Rassist“) in die oberen Gehaltsklassen auf. Am Vorabend der Präsidentschaftswahl von 2008 sagte Sean Hannity: „Ich glaube kaum, dass eine Präsidentschaft Barack Obamas gut für dieses Land wäre. Aber sie wäre hervorragend fürs Talk Radio.“ Und natürlich für die Gehälter der Radio-Köpfe.
Text: F.A.Z.
Bildmaterial: AFP, AP, dapd, Reuters

description.hltext_display: 嫦娥二号从容应对月食 3小时走出阴影区
description.content:
http://www.qianlong.com/2010-12-22 16:03:46千龙网
北京晚报讯（记者 蔡文清 通讯员 姜宁）昨天14时50分，正在绕月飞行的嫦娥二号卫星遭遇月食，北京航天飞控中心根据事先的计划，有条不紊地对卫星实施了控制，3小时后卫星走出阴影区，安然度过月食考验。
北京航天飞控中心副总工程师周建亮介绍，月食期间嫦娥二号卫星面临三大考验:一是仅靠蓄电池长时间运行；二是卫星直接面对太空零下200℃的低温；三是受地球自转、月食发生时刻影响，国内测控站不能全程跟踪和控制卫星。
面对诸多挑战，北京航天飞控中心于11月30日开始对卫星进行相位调整，即通过调整轨道，每圈改变它的轨道周期约10秒钟，经过20多天的累积，使月食发生时卫星处于阴影区的时长最短。逐步关闭卫星上的CCD相机等“非必需”设备，就像进入“冬眠”状态，只保证大脑和心脏运行。卫星走出月食环境便会逐步打开，恢复各项设备运行。调整卫星姿态，使太阳帆板一直对着太阳，确保在进入月食之前蓄电池保持充满状态。此外由于嫦娥二号卫星进入月食阴影前6小时处于国内测控站跟踪范围之外，为填补这期间的测控空白，通过国际合作，由欧洲空间局测控站为嫦娥二号卫星提供测控支持，保证了卫星在月食前后均能获得有效的监测，确保了卫星安全度过月食。

description.hltext_display: 搜狗输入法疑被封杀 官方提示别用360升级
description.content:
DoNews 12月22日消息，搜狗对外发出声明，“搜狗拼音输入法”在360软件管家出现升级安装问题，提示用户不要使用360升级。
近日，大量搜狗拼音输入法的用户向我们反馈，在使用360软件管家升级安装搜狗拼音输入法最新版本之后，出现无法正常使用的情况。
搜狗表示，除360软件管家提供的升级版本外，通过其他软件下载渠道下载、升级的搜狗拼音输入法相应版本，均未发现上述问题。提示用户暂时不要使用360升级。(完)
近日，大量搜狗拼音输入法的用户向我们反馈，在使用360软件管家升级安装搜狗拼音输入法最新版本之后，出现无法正常使用的情况。为保障用户利益、确保搜狗输入法良好的使用体验，搜狗特做如下紧急公告：
2、对于已经通过360软件管家升级安装并出现上述故障的用户，首先请将系统默认输入法设为“美式键盘”或其他输入法后重启电脑，然后从搜狗拼音输入法官网首页下载最新版本安装包(pinyin.sogou.com )，重新进行安装，即可解决问题。
3、根据我们调查了解，除360软件管家提供的升级版本外，通过其他软件下载渠道下载、升级的搜狗拼音输入法相应版本，均未发现上述问题，请广大搜狗用户放心升级使用。

description.hltext_display: Homeless who died in 2010 recognized during service
description.author: Kibkabe Araya
description.content:
Wearing a black-and-teal hard shell jacket with a black beanie cap resting right above his eyebrows, Wayne Lievsay of Redding walked up to the podium at a Tuesday memorial service for the homeless who lost their lives this year.
“It’s hard being on the streets,” he said to 60 supporters who came out to pay their respects at Living Hope Compassion Ministries in Redding. “The worst thing yet is dying on the street.”
Lievsay knew four of the roughly 13 people who died this year, one including his camp mate who was struck by a train. “That hurt a lot,” he said.
The city of Redding and Shasta County Continuum of Care Council also coordinated an evening memorial service at Good News Rescue Mission in Redding.
Since 1990, the National Coalition for the Homeless, National Consumer Advisory Board and the National Health Care for the Homeless Council chose the first day of winter to be National Homeless Persons’ Memorial Day. With the new season comes the longest night of the year, leaving Shasta County’s homeless more exposed to the dropping temperatures and rain showers. Many die each year in the U.S. from exposure.
As the program director of Living Hope, Jordan Storment does not know people only by face. He knows their names, their stories, making the memorial particularly important for him. “It’s not a statistic that dies. It’s not a number,” he told the audience, fighting back tears. “You’re a friend. You’re family.”
The half-hour memorial came to an end with a prayer. “It’s really hard, and it makes me sad at the same time,” Storment said. “The idea of lumping all these lives together in one memorial. Everyone gets an individual memorial. It’s really sad that people pass away unnoticed. That breaks my heart.”
As unemployment rose to 15.7 percent in Shasta County last month, Delaney said a 40 percent increase in homelessness in the past two years has affected the community.
“We might see more people pass away than in the past because there’s more out there, unfortunately,” said Jessica Delaney, the coordinator at the Continuum of Care Council.
Organizations that work with the homeless in Shasta County hear of deaths from word-of-mouth and confirm them through the Department of Public Health. The leading causes of death for the homeless include exposure, violence, homicide, mental health issues and a prolonged lack of medical care. In 2009 more than 133,000 Californians were homeless.
After the memorial, it was lunchtime. Like a few others, Lievsay headed outside for a smoke. For seven years, he’s lived on the streets. Losing his landscaping job at the Forest Service after 10 years, coupled with a devastating divorce, left him homeless. “The emotional heartbreak of that shut me down, and I never got back on my feet,” he said.
He pitches his tent in different places around town until he’s evicted. To alleviate his hunger, he goes to Living Hope for a hot meal because, he said, it’s a great place to get what he needs.
Inside, Storment and volunteers headed to the kitchen to begin preparing meals for the line starting to spill out the door. “People are hungry for relationships, for someone to care,” he said. “Someone can hand someone a plate of food and not care.” Storment, a Simpson University grad, said he sits down and eats lunch alongside the homeless to build relationships that can help sustain them through difficult times.
This is the 10th year Shasta County has been involved with the memorial. “I don’t think people who live this life deserve to disappear in silence,”
Delaney said. “The community needs to come together to say goodbye.”

开心网与爱帮团合作尝试团购植入模式
description.content:
【TechWeb消息】12月22日消息，爱帮团已经与开心网达成战略合作，将限时团购的电子商务形式推荐给开心网友。届时，开心网用户可以在自己的开心主页实现团购产品的在线购买了。
据爱帮网产品及市场总监魏刚介绍：“此次与开心网合作非常顺利，之所以能如此快速达成战略合作是爱帮与开心有着相同价值观，我们希望通过开心网的平台与更多网友分享团购乐趣，爱帮团非常重视此次与开心网的内置合作”。
开心网商务总监刘绮强调，“我们认为电子商务是开心网用户非常需要的一类产品，我们将根据用户的需求在电子商务领域方面做更多探索，推出更多更好的受用户喜爱的电子商务类产品与服务。”刘绮表示愿意和爱帮网这样有规模、重信用的网站开展深入合作。
爱帮团是爱帮网旗下于4月22日上线的限时团购网站，从上线之日起迅速获得了网民和商家的喜爱，目前已经布局全国8座消费型大中型城市，以骄人的成绩进入了中国团购网站第一阵营。爱帮团立志做最值得信赖的团购网站，以“发现精彩生活”为口号，成为人们精品、时尚、实惠生活的指南，同时在产品和模式方面不断创新，为用户和商家提供更多、更大价值。（李晴）

description.hltext_display: V debatnej súťaži o internetovom pirátstve ...Bratislava 20. decembra (TASR) - Tím z Evanjelického kolegiálneho gymnázia v Prešove (Veronika Soporská, Michal Adam, Ján Cina) zvíťazil v druhom v�...
description.content:
"Soporská získala aj tretí najvyšší počet rečníckych bodov. Predstihli ju iba Košičania Simona Masicová z Gymnázia sv. Tomáša Akvinského a Michal Papcún z Gymnázia Trebišovská, " uviedol pre TASR Miroslav Nemčok zo Slovenskej debatnej asociácie (SDA). � tvorkolovej súťaže sa zúčastnilo 75 stredoškolákov. Počas príprav pred podujatím sa museli zorientovať v problematike internetového pirátstva a navrhnúť možné riešenia jeho legalizáciou alebo obhajovať súčasný stav ako lepšiu voľbu. Všetky trojčlenné tímy v dvoch kolách obhajovali aj vyvracali tézu s názvom Majetkové autorské práva by sa nemali vzťahovať na nekomerčné šírenie spravodajské, umelecké a vedeckých diel. V ďalších dvoch kolách debatovali o tézach, ktoré sa dozvedeli iba hodinu pred začiatkom.
Podujatie zorganizovala SDA, ktorá zastrešuje celý program akademickej debaty na Slovensku. Do programu zaradila aj semináre zamerané na zdokonalenie debatných zručností. Akademická debata je vzdelávacia aktivita, ktorá učí kriticky myslieť a oponovať. Jej účastníci sú rozdelení na dve strany reprezentujúce opačné pozície v názorovom spektre. Oba trojčlenné tímy presviedčajú rozhodcov o platnosti alebo neplatnosti zadanej tézy.

微软已经开始内部测试Windows 8
description.content:
2010年12月22日 15:08 驱动之家 【大 中 小】 【打印】 共有评论0条
Windows 8的开发工作已经开始，微软虽然还没有向测试人员提供内部测试版本，不过已经对这一系统进行dogfooding。dogfooding的含义基本等同于内部测试，按照传统，微软会让其员工在产品开发的初期阶段进行试用测试，包括Windows系统。
有消息称Windows 8将在2011年下半年公开Beta测试版，让广大用户参与到测试中来。从媒体曝光的Windows 8两类版本号中，我们也能看到Windows 8的两种进度。目前已知的两个不同的开发分支版本号为Build 6.1.7764.0.100615-1748和Build 6.2.7901。
微软当前并没有对Windows 8的开发计划发表公开评论，不过根据传统，Windows 8有望在2012年发布。

description.hltext_display: La Bourse de Paris stable à l'ouverture, Poweo s'envole
description.content:
La bourse de paris stable dans les premiers échanges
PARIS (Reuters) - La Bourse de Paris a ouvert sur une note pratiquement stable alors que l'indice CAC 40 est tout proche d'effacer ses pertes de l'année et que les investisseurs préfèrent ne pas prendre de positions importantes avant la fin de l'année.
A 9h09 le CAC 40 prend 0,03%, à 3.926,44 points, après avoir ouvert en très léger repli, et se rapproche ainsi de son cours de clôture du 31 décembre, à 3.936,33 points.
Du côté des valeurs, Poweo bondit de 12,25% suite à l'annonce de la vente de ses actifs de production à Verbund, cependant qu'Hermès gagne plus de 4% après que LVMH a annoncé mardi soir détenir plus de 20% du sellier.
En revanche, Ingenico recule de 3,77%, après avoir dit mardi soir n'avoir reçu aucune offre ferme et ne mener aucune discussion sur son capital.
Les autres grandes places européennes évoluent également sur une note hésitante, Londres et Francfort prenant toutes les deux 0,05%. Du côté des indices paneuropéens, l'EuroStoxx 50 gagne 0,14% et l'EuroFirst 300 progresse de 0,19%.
L'euro prend 0,34% sur le billet vert et se négocie au-dessus de 1,31 dollar, à 1,3146 dollar.
Le baril de brut léger américain gagne 0,27%, à 90,06 dollars.
Alexandre Boksenbaum-Granier, édité par Jean-Michel Bélot
FERMER X
Crédit : REUTERS

description.hltext_display: Am liebsten ordentlich und einsam
description.author: Nicole Karafyllis
description.content:
Das Weltbild von Wikileaks
Die eindeutige Lesbarkeit der Welt ist ein alter Menschheitstraum. Gegenwärtig wird er über die Plattform Wikileaks neu verhandelt. Julian Assange und seine Jünger sind dabei so etwas wie die autistischen Heimarbeiter der Transparenz.
Sehnsucht nach Ordnung und Einsamkeit: WikiLeaks-Gründer Julian Assange auf einer Pressekonferenz
Als der Kinderarzt Hans Asperger 1943 seine Habilitationsschrift über die „Autistischen Psychopathen“ im Kindesalter an der Universität Wien einreichte, beschrieb er die geniale Fähigkeit der kleinen Jungen, die Welt ganz klar zu sehen. Autisten zeigten eine besondere Klarsichtigkeit, ihre ideale Welt ist geordnet, die Dinge haben ihren Platz. In dieser geordneten Welt hat jedes Ding genau einen Namen. Metaphern, Ironie, Diplomatie – all jene Formen von Distanz zum Objekt der Erkenntnis scheinen viele Autisten nicht zu verstehen.
Die eindeutige Lesbarkeit der Welt ist ein alter Menschheitstraum. Gegenwärtig wird er über die Plattform WikiLeaks neu verhandelt. Informationen bedürfen keiner Vermittlung und keiner wertenden Distanz mehr, so die Proponenten von Wikileaks. Informationen tragen vielmehr die Essenz ihrer Bedeutung in sich. Diese Position war im Mittelalter prominent, allerdings unter anderen Vorzeichen. Es war Gott, der die Essenzen in die Dinge legte, und es war daher auch nicht allen unbedingt möglich, die von Gott geordnete Welt klar zu sehen. Klarsichtigkeit war vielmehr an göttliche Gnade gekoppelt. Von daher birgt der normative Anspruch auf Transparenz, den Julian Assange und seine Jünger vertreten, ein zutiefst religiöses Element. Das Genie zeigt sich dabei in einer neuen Form, als transhumanes Subjekt, das wegen seiner technischen Fähigkeiten im Umgang mit Daten und Computern über die menschliche Gattung hinausweist und die Masse der Nicht-Sehenden in Gnadenakten informiert.
Der neue „leader“ der IT-Gesellschaft
Als Hans Asperger damals den Autismus als Psychopathie kategorisierte, wies er darauf hin, dass es sich um eine Störung handelt, unter der mehr die Gesellschaft leidet als der Betroffene selbst. In den letzten Jahren ist der Asperger-Autismus zu einer kulturellen Metapher für die Einsamkeit des postmodernen Subjekts geworden, das in der IT-Gesellschaft virtuell seine Netzwerke knüpft. Viele derjenigen, die sich zur intellektuellen Oberschicht der Cybersociety zählen, identifizieren sich mit dem Asperger-Syndrom. Die Hacker-Szene feiert sich gerne in sogenannten „nerd-clubs“. Dann gehen die Heimarbeiter der Transparenz wieder nach Hause. In der Populärkultur hat sich seit dem Film „Rain Man“ (1988) den Eindruck verfestigt, Autist seien stets weiße Männer aus der Mittelschicht, die von Zahlen und Technik besessen sind. Dieses Bild hat die vielen Autisten, die nicht über besondere kognitive Fähigkeiten verfügen und um bessere Therapieangebote kämpfen, in den Hintergrund treten lassen. Deshalb fällt in amerikanischen Autismus-Selbsthilfegruppen oft der Ausdruck „neuroelitism“: Neuro-Elitismus.
Eine der Ikonen der neuroelitären Cybercommunity ist Bill Gates, der zwar nie medizinisch als Asperger-Autist diagnostiziert wurde, aber dessen Schwierigkeiten im sozialen Umgang und außergewöhnlich hoher IQ für eine Ferndiagnose schon vor Jahren ausgereicht haben. Julian Assange wird sicherlich bald in der spekulativen Pathografie nachfolgen, denn er passt perfekt in das generierte Diskursmuster von männlicher Genialität, sozialer Zurückgezogenheit, Klarsichtigkeit und IT-Elite. Auch die dem Autisten unterstellte Unfähigkeit zu lügen, fundamental gewendet in einen natürlichen Anspruch auf Wahrheit, erhöht die Plausibilität. Dass einer der führenden Autismusforscher, Simon Baron-Cohen aus Cambridge, ständig publiziert, der Autist mit seinem „extrem männlichen Gehirn“ sei der neue „leader“ der IT-Gesellschaft, befördert entsprechende Diskurse.
Eine verkabelte Ontologie der Hardware
Allerdings bezieht man sich mit diesem Geniekonzept auf eine Ontologie und Weltsicht, die direkt in die Hochscholastik führt. Schon im Sommer titelte der britische Observer einen Artikel über Julian Assange mit „Mönch des Online-Zeitalters“, spielte damit aber nur auf dessen angebliche Zurückgezogenheit und Autarkiestreben an. Der Autist ist eine kulturelle Metapher für Solipsismus und Nominalismus. Die Welt existiert für ihn nur insoweit, wie mentale Repräsentationen sich direkt auf Objekte beziehen können. Dabei werden die Relationen durch die Objekte selbst generiert. Wenn Computer und Gehirn strukturell immer mehr identifiziert werden, darf man sich nicht wundern, wenn nun das Konzept „Wahrheit“ mit einem Informations-Determinismus versehen wird. Aufklärung wäre dann eine Totalität an zur Verfügung stehenden Daten „für alle“.
Dabei scheinen kulturelle, intersubjektiv und historisch gewachsene Semantiken entbehrlich. In dieser mittelalterlichen Ontologie, die, elektronisch tiefergelegt, im engeren Sinne gar keine mehr ist, da sie zwischen Sein und Seiendem nicht mehr trennt, sind die kulturellen Fundierungsverhältnisse nicht mitgedacht. Die Cyberwelt hat vielmehr eine verkabelte Ontologie der Hardware. Der aufklärerische Gedanke Kants, dass das „Ding an sich“ der Erkenntnis nicht zugänglich ist, scheint in dieser Parallelwelt nie angekommen. Plurale Deutungsmöglichkeiten scheinen dort gefährlich. Die Sehnsucht nach Ordnung ist zu groß. Die nach Einsamkeit auch.
Nicole Karafyllis ist Professorin für Philosophie an der Technischen Universität Braunschweig und zur Zeit Senior Research Fellow am IFK Wien.

description.hltext_display: 18:24 - Russia ispeziona esercito svizzero
Primátor P.Obrimčák a poslanci zložili slá...Stropkov 21. decembra (TASR) – Na ustanovujúcom zasadnutí Mestského zastupiteľstva v Stropkove (MsZ), ktoré sa konalo v pondelok (20.12. ), zložili p...
description.content: Funkciu zástupcu primátora mesta bude vykonávať poslanec MsZ Pavol Kačic (ĽS-HZDS). TASR o tom dnes informoval hovorca mestského úradu Imrich Makó.Obrimčák je primátorom od roku 2006 a v novembrových voľbách získal od občanov mandát na ďalšie štyri roky. Zdôraznil, že do funkcie vstupuje so zreteľným a jasným vedomím zodpovednosti za ďalší vývoj a rozvoj mesta."Začíname nové volebné obdobie, ktoré podobne ako to predchádzajúce, nebude jednoduché. Nemožno však hovoriť o začiatku, kedy za všetkým urobíme hrubú čiaru a začneme odznova. Naša práca nutne nadväzuje na začaté projekty a nedokončené investície, " konštatoval primátor.Dodal, že občania od vedenia mesta očakávajú transparentnosť, prístup k informáciám a predovšetkým dialóg. V nasledujúcich štyroch rokoch sa budú snažiť urobiť všetko pre to, aby občania nadobudli pocit a presvedčenie, že vedenie mesta je tu pre nich.Poslanci sa na svojom prvom zasadnutí venovali predovšetkým voľbám vyplývajúcim zo zákona o obecnom zriadení. V rámci programu zvolili šesťčlennú mestskú radu a predsedov komisií, ktoré budú pracovať pri mestskom zastupiteľstve.Podľa prednostu MsÚ Ivana Klebana by vzhľadom na zloženie poslaneckého zboru mohli v mestskom parlamente pôsobiť až tri poslanecké kluby. Upozornil však, že ich konštituovanie je v štádiu rokovaní a konkrétne zloženie a počet bude známy na januárovom zasadnutí zastupiteľstva.

中国互联网产业年会打� 产业发展风向� �
description.content:
凤凰网科技讯 12月22日消息，由中国互联网协会主办、中国网民文化节组委会和中国互联网大会组委会承办的中国互联网产业年会将于2011年1月18日在北京钓鱼台国宾馆举行。本次年会的主题为“把握网络经济脉搏、发掘产业新生力量”，旨在于岁末年初之际盘点互联网产业年度发展成果、发布未来一年产业发展趋势。届时，2010中国互联网产业年度百强、创新奖、人气奖、值得期待奖以及年度贡献奖将在年会上同步揭晓。
近十年来，中国互联网产业发展迅猛，新服务业态层出不穷、和实体产业融合愈加紧密、迅速渗透并转变人们的生活方式……2010年，我国“十一五”规划步入收官之年，在迎来“十二五”之际，我国的互联网产业少不了对业界变化的梳理与深思，在总结经验、肯定成果的基础上分析走向、探索趋势。中国互联网协会作为我国互联网shierwu行业全国性社会组织，希冀在对行业的总揽盘点上积极发挥导向作用，打造产业发展的风向标。
据互联网协会负责人介绍，当前的中国互联网产业正处于多元融合的阶段，互联网产业作为基础性产业、支撑性产业、渗透性产业，面临和实体产业的融合、与人们生活方式转变的融合；同时，互联网产业内新兴服务业态发展迅速，令人们眼花缭乱，在带来巨大机遇的同时也蕴含风险与模糊。中国互联网产业年会将从产业高度出发，深度聚焦互联网发展热门领域以及细分市场，着重表彰有价值的发展成果、探索有创新、有成长性的应用前景；产业年会希望依托协会的行业影响力和权威性，充分发挥意见领袖导向作用，通过所颁奖项的入围条件及指标体系传递产业年会倡导理念及鼓励精神，着力引导业界关注、促进细分领域发展。
据悉，截止到目前，除工信部、国新办、文化部及国家工商总局的领导外，GOOGLE 全球副总裁刘允、奇虎360董事长周鸿祎、创新工场董事长兼CEO李开复、英特尔中国区总裁杨叙、人民搜索总裁邓亚萍等著名企业家已应邀出席产业年会，同时来自中国人民大学、中国传媒大学等高校的学者以及行业分析师也将到场参会。作为产业发展风向标，年会还将现场研讨并预测2011产业趋势。究竟本次产业年会颁出的各大奖项花落谁家，十二五开年之时最火的应用是什么，一切结果只能到1月18日钓鱼台揭晓了。
活动抢票：http://accii2010.wangminjie.cn/ticket/index.php
中国互联网协会
中国网民文化节组委会
中国互联网大会组委会
